meanings.definition: A tool with a heavy metal head mounted at right angles at the end of a handle, used for jobs such as breaking things and driving in nails.
meanings.sent1: Dad used the hammer to fix the loose shelf.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter always carries a hammer in his toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the hammer to crack a nut.
meanings.sent4: Her words hit him like a hammer, leaving him stunned.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hammer hitting the nail echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: To strike or pound with or as if with a hammer.
meanings.sent1: She had to hammer the nail into the wall to hang the picture.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would hammer the hot metal to shape it.
meanings.sent3: He tried to hammer out a solution to the problem.
meanings.sent4: The rain hammered against the window all night long.
meanings.sent5: The boxer continued to hammer his opponent with powerful punches.

meanings.definition: A metal ball with a long handle, thrown for distance in a track-and-field event.
meanings.sent1: The athlete trained hard to throw the hammer farther than before.
meanings.sent2: The hammer event is always exciting to watch in the Olympics.
meanings.sent3: The hammer landed just a few inches short of the record.
meanings.sent4: The hammer spun gracefully through the air before landing.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the hammer flew through the sky.
